modules.description: Provides functions to construct an input source from a Unix file descriptor, enabling parsing of file content. Works with Unix.file_descr and Reparse.input types. Used to feed data from open files into a parser for structured processing.

Parses and processes file content using custom syntax rules, extracting structured data from text inputs. It operates on strings and file descriptors, handling line-by-line and block-based analysis. Used to restructure configuration files and transform raw input into executable commands.

Handles input sourcing from Unix file descriptors, allowing structured parsing of file content through integration with Reparse.input. Supports operations on Unix.file_descr and Reparse.input to enable low-level data processing. For example, it can read from an open file and pass its contents to a parser for syntax analysis or transformation. This facilitates direct interaction between file I/O and parsing workflows.
